cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a downlink multiuser MISO system with bounded errors in the channel state information at the transmitter (CSIT), which is a problem in information theory (cs.IT). The paper proposes a rate-splitting (RS) strategy to achieve max-min fairness amongst users, which involves encoding and decoding of messages, and linear precoding of symbol streams, which are topics in networking (cs.NI) and signal processing (cs.SI). The paper also discusses the performance gains of the proposed algorithm over state-of-the-art designs, which is a topic in machine learning (cs.MM) and optimization (cs.LG).
